creator: thomas@wyona.com
text:
Strange characters apear around some items in the sitetree-menu (for
instance "Â Home Â". My local installation running on Mac OS X shows this issue
on the insert link screen only. Others report a broken sitetree-menu on the main
info pane under debian linux.

creator: josias.thoeny@wyona.org
text:
I think 'Â' appears if a document contains the utf-8 character   and the
document is serialized as iso or is (mis)interpreted as iso by the browser.
I guess it should disappear if one switches the browser to utf-8, but I don't
have a clue why the encoding is wrong or not recognized correctly.
You could check the encoding info in the html source.

creator: gregor@apache.org
text:
try changing the xml serializer in 1.2 to utf-8. there was a regression where it
has been erroneously set to iso 8859-1. if this solves your problem, i will
change it in the sitemap.

does this fix the problem, thomas?

note that i made the xml serializer in 1.2 use utf-8 again
creator: gregor@apache.org
gregor@apache.org
text:
this might be the reason:

http://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26997#c3

if so, try switching to the new serializers block to see if it resolves things

creator: thomas@wyona.com
text:
Re #3: no, that did't fix it. 
Re #4: think I tried this some weeks ago and it didn't help either.

creator: gregor@apache.org
text: can you try again? there was just a serializer fix that might help
